qa_pairs.question: What are Jason's future academic plans and current living situation?
qa_pairs.answer: Jason just graduated from Washington High School and is going to UC Berkeley for environmental engineering. He lives in the outer Mission.
qa_pairs.source_text: hi my name is Jason I just graduated from Washington High School Im going to be going to UC Berkeley for environmental engineering and I live in the outer mission

qa_pairs.question: Where does Kelly live and what is her current educational status?
qa_pairs.answer: Kelly lives in the outer Mission and is currently a senior at Galleria.
qa_pairs.source_text: my name is Kelly I also live in the Auto mission and Im currently a senior at Galleria

qa_pairs.question: Where was Jackie born and raised, and what is her current educational status?
qa_pairs.answer: Jackie was born and raised in the Bay View along the borders of District 9 and 10, and she is entering her senior year at Lowell High School.
qa_pairs.source_text: hi my name is Jackie I was born and raised in the Bay View along the borders of like District 9 and 10. so Im not too far into the beefy though and I am entering my senior year at Lowell High School

qa_pairs.question: What changes has Tracy observed in her neighborhood in the outer Mission?
qa_pairs.answer: Tracy has observed that there are primarily single-family homes around her area, but towards Alemany, more apartment buildings are popping up. In the business districts on Mission and Geneva, many businesses have remained the same for about 10 years, and the same bus lines have been around, indicating not much change in her neighborhood.
qa_pairs.source_text: Tracy and most of my family is physically from The Bayview District more towards like mission I live in the outer Mission and its primarily like a single family homes around my area towards alimony which is a busier Street theres started to be more apartment buildings popping up and by Balboa Park theres been one more and the business districts on Mission and Geneva a lot of the businesses have are the same ones from like 10 years ago so theyve been doing well and transportation those same bus lines have been around so not much change in my neighborhood

qa_pairs.question: What housing developments has Kelly noticed in the outer Mission?
qa_pairs.answer: Kelly has noticed a lot more affordable housing being built in the outer Mission, with previously unused lots being repurposed into housing units.
qa_pairs.source_text: I live in the outer Mission but Ive noticed that like in the time living there Ive kind of noticed theres a lot more like affordable housing being built up there are a lot of like unused Lots before like ones like close to the Safeway there and stuff like that but now theyre getting actually repurposed and getting built into housing units which has really nice to see

qa_pairs.question: What has Jackie observed about housing and business development in Bayview?
qa_pairs.answer: Jackie has seen a lot of housing development in Bayview, particularly on the east side of the city, with a mix of taller buildings and single-family homes. She has also observed businesses coming and going, with some long-standing ones continuing to do well.
qa_pairs.source_text: for me like I said I was born and raised in Bayview and thats where Ive seen a lot of housing develop in our city I know most of its been on the east side of the city and thats where the Bay View is um Ive lived primarily in like one or two homes in the babies that havent moved often uh and most of the or I guess its a mix of taller buildings and also um single family homes in the Bayview and I think especially in like the silver tirins area weve seen a lot of development weve seen taller buildings um and in the Hunters Point area too theres a lot of development there and in terms of the businesses in the area I think Ive seen businesses come and go whether theyre supermarkets theres ice cream shops so I think um theres its a mix theres also ones that have been in the neighborhood for a while and that continued to be continue to be doing really well

qa_pairs.question: What is Kelly's perspective on housing development in Hunters Point and Bayview?
qa_pairs.answer: Kelly agrees with Jackie that there has been a lot of construction and more apartments and affordable housing in Hunters Point and Bayview. She notes that across the street from her grandma's house, a new multi-use industrial building was built, indicating a need for more housing.
qa_pairs.source_text: yeah I kind of agree with Jackie theres living a lot of like um construction and more apartments and affordable housing in the Hunters Point area and in Bayview I see that there will across the street from my Grandmas house they did build a new like a Maltese industrial building so I feel like they maybe do need to have a little bit more housing but other than that its um a good um housing

qa_pairs.question: What was Jason's family's housing situation before he was born?
qa_pairs.answer: Before Jason was born, his family lived in a very small rented area in North Beach with his grandparents, which was super cramped. They then moved to the outer Mission where Jason was born.
qa_pairs.source_text: oh yeah so my family before I was born they were living in like North Beach area they were renting a very small area with my grandparents so super cramped and then uh they moved over to the outer mission where I live now and then I was born so I wasnt able to experience that so I cant speak much about that

qa_pairs.question: How did Kelly's grandparents contribute to her family's housing situation?
qa_pairs.answer: Kelly's grandparents immigrated earlier on and settled in the Chinatown area, working hard and taking up various jobs. They were able to save money and fund it down to Kelly's dad, which helped the family buy a house in the Emeryville area.
qa_pairs.source_text: yeah I kind of like add on to my like whole thing so my I think my grandpa and my grandma have actually immigrated here like earlier on and so it was during kind of like I dont know the time where a lot of people immigrated over like on the ships and stuff like that no complains nothing like that but they made it here earlier on and then they kind of settled in the Chinatown area where a lot of Chinese immigrants did at that time and they took up a few like random jobs here and there but they worked really hard and so using like some of that money they were able to fund it down to my dad where we actually got a house in the Emeryville area

qa_pairs.question: What attracted Jackie's parents to San Francisco?
qa_pairs.answer: Jackie's parents were attracted to San Francisco because of its strong cultural neighborhoods, like Chinatown, which appealed to them as newly arrived immigrants.
qa_pairs.source_text: Im actually pretty similar to Kellys story my parents also immigrated here um a few decades ago and I guess would primarily drill in the San Francisco is probably like the culture similar to what Kelly said once again just like having um such strong um cultural neighborhoods like Chinatown for example um that really attracted them here especially as um newly arrived immigrants

qa_pairs.question: Why did Jackie's family move to the Bayview and District 10?
qa_pairs.answer: Jackie's family moved to the Bayview and District 10 because the houses there are more affordable compared to other areas in San Francisco.
qa_pairs.source_text: and um I know um on my mothers side at least um she started Living on Gary Boulevard along the um that area um like in the Richmond area but over time Ive noticed that most of my family have moved to like the Bay View to um to district 10 like this area with like the station Valley too yeah because these houses are like more affordable

qa_pairs.question: What has been the impact of rising housing prices on Jackie's family?
qa_pairs.answer: Rising housing prices have led Jackie's family to move to more affordable neighborhoods like the Bayview and Visitacion Valley. Some family members have left San Francisco for other cities around the Bay Area, such as San Mateo, San Bruno, and even further out to places like Sacramento.
qa_pairs.source_text: I before my mom used to live in San Francisco she lived there like most of her life and then I was born in Castro Valley I stayed in the East Bay um and then I moved to um Hayward and then I spent most of my time there and then I just kept like moving further out but my family always stayed in in San Francisco so I was always visiting like especially like multiple times a month and um yeah actually that was probably the reason why I would move further out because it kept getting more and more expensive and my mom moved away from San Francisco too um and yeah so I think the price is like really increasing a lot yeah I definitely agree um and I think like I said before um I feel like the prices increase like its not uh proportional like every neighborhood um doesnt increase at the same rate so we have some neighborhoods that are um that have housing prices that are way higher than others and thats why most of my family at least that have stayed in San Francisco they have moved to like cheaper or like more affordable neighborhoods like the Bayview and physician Valley but I also have family members who have left the city for um for other cities around the bay area area whether thats um San Mateo or or um San Bruno and also a family whove moved further further out east like Sacramento and Ive also seen teachers Ive also seen other neighbors who have moved and relocated because its been because housing prices have Rose so much

qa_pairs.question: What challenges did Kelly's family face when trying to move back to San Francisco?
qa_pairs.answer: Kelly's family faced challenges moving back to San Francisco due to rising housing prices. They sold their house in Emeryville and wanted to move back to the city, but during the time spent between selling and finding a new house, housing prices rose significantly, making it difficult for middle-class families to afford homes.
qa_pairs.source_text: are you kind of like Ill get on to that for my own like personal experiences and so like I said earlier my parents did it ended up like selling the house in Emeryville and they wanted to move back into the city because we like our entire like lives are kind of like in the city and so commuting across the bay bridge who was really just tiring I know its a lot of driving for my parents and so we want to move in but then in the like I guess time spent between selling the house and finding a new house in SF thousand prizes that really rose up like that was kind of like way before the pandemic but it was like a time where like a lot of like middle class families getting priced out of even like neighborhoods like the outer Mission or Bayview and so during that time I just kind of even though I was like really young I was still in like middle school and stuff like that I kind of saw the fact that like so many of these houses like their prices were Rising but the incomes of the families that wanted to live in them they werent Rising nearly as high and so I kind of saw like these houses go from like even going to open houses I saw that like before it was mainly like normal families going there but later on itd be more like investors going there and I saw more like four and like foreign investors like sending like people out there to the open house and so like even though I was so young I would see like the market in SF just go crazy

qa_pairs.question: How did Jason's family manage to buy a house in San Francisco before prices rose significantly?
qa_pairs.answer: Jason's family bought their house in 2003, before the economic situation in San Francisco made housing very expensive. At that time, it was a reasonable choice for a middle-income family to make a down payment on a house.
qa_pairs.source_text: uh yeah so my family got our bought our house in 2003 so that was before the economics uh got really expensive in San Francisco so I think nowadays its like if youre gonna make a down payment on a house with like a middle income in your family its like super difficult but then back then it was actually a reasonable choice

qa_pairs.question: What are Jason's views on housing policy and homelessness in San Francisco?
qa_pairs.answer: Jason believes that making more types of housing available, such as affordable housing, market rate, and transitional housing for unhoused people, would alleviate the burden of trying to get a property. He also thinks homelessness is a big problem in San Francisco and suggests making things more affordable or raising income to help people get off the streets.
qa_pairs.source_text: so its like making more types of housing available would really alleviate that uh burden of trying to get a property but not being able to afford it so like uh affordable housing some like market rate and also like uh the what do you call it the transitional housing for uh unhoused people um policy maybe like more information like things being posted around so I can help more people especially people who are like not on track and everything I actually need help and also um I think homelessness is a really big problem to San Francisco so I think I guess trying to help people get off the streets and also make things a little more affordable or at least raise income

qa_pairs.question: What public services and spaces does Jackie find important in San Francisco?
qa_pairs.answer: Jackie finds having a public library nearby, open spaces like parks, and being close to a commercial corridor with retail shops and local businesses important. She values these public services and spaces for their contribution to making San Francisco a more livable place.
qa_pairs.source_text: for me I think when I when I heard the question I mostly thought about public spaces public services and personally I think I found having for example like a public library nearby really important having Open Spaces Club Parks areas to to just jog outside or spend time outside um that to be really important too as well as um as well as having um or being close to like a commercial Corridor where we have retail shops where we have local businesses um supermarkets um yeah I found out to be really important as well

qa_pairs.question: What does Jackie suggest for improving collaboration among city departments in San Francisco?
qa_pairs.answer: Jackie suggests that more collaboration between different city departments, such as SF Public Library, SF Rec and Park, and the Department of Children, Youth, and Their Families, could yield better results in making San Francisco a more livable place for young people and families.
qa_pairs.source_text: and um I think looking forward Id love to see more collaboration with between different city departments I know San Francisco is a really large city we have a lot of City departments and a lot of them are doing like really important work um and there are a few that work especially close with young people um I know like I mentioned like SF Public Library SF reckon Park our department of children youth and their families um yeah and they have a lot of like great programs that aim to make San Francisco a more livable place for young people and also make it a place where individuals would like to race kids yeah so I think if there was more collaboration between like these different agencies and these different departments um um they could definitely yield better results in the long term
